Generation III.Ruby: Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This Pok é mon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
Generation III.Sapphire: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pok é mon is capable of topping 60 mph , it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.
Generation III.Emerald: It is exceedingly fast if it only has to run in a straight line. When it spots pond-dwelling prey underwater, it quickly leaps in and catches it with its sharp claws.
Generation III.FireRed: When running in a straight line, it can top 60 miles per hour . However, it has a tough time with curved roads.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When running in a straight line, it can top 60 miles per hour . However, it has a tough time with curved roads.

Generation IV.Diamond: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph . However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
Generation IV.Pearl: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph . However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
Generation IV.Platinum: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph . However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
Generation IV.HeartGold: When running in a straight line, it can easily top 60 miles an hour . It has a tough time with curved roads.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When running in a straight line, it can easily top 60 miles an hour . It has a tough time with curved roads.

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This Pokémon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping 60 mph , it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.

Generation VIII.Sword: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.
Generation VIII.Shield: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph . However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph . However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
